title: Rotational kinematics - theta derivative at 2 sec

content.question: The angular position of a rotating object is given by <math alttext="theta equals 2 t squared, minus 5 t plus 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is time in seconds and <math alttext="theta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>θ</mi></math> is the angular position in radians. What is the object’s angular velocity at <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="1 radian per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="2 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="3 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="4 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
